message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.SE

The paper deals with anomaly detection in Industrial Control Systems (ICS/SCADA) networks, which are a critical infrastructure for many industries. The paper proposes a new model for anomaly detection that takes into account the temporal phase shifts in the traffic. This involves detecting changes in the communication patterns over time, and incorporating multiple phases of the traffic in the model. This work is relevant to the Computer Security (cs.CR) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories, as it deals with security and communication in networks. The paper also proposes a new sampling mechanism for training set assembly, which involves machine learning techniques, and is relevant to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The proposed model is designed to monitor and control a process, which is relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a new anomaly detection model, which involves software engineering techniques, and is relevant to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
